word.entryDescription: something pretty that grows on a plant, often brightly-coloured with a pleasant smell
word.entryExample: There aren't any flowers in this garden.

word.entryDescription: having a pattern of flowers
word.entryExample: This flowery dress is really pretty!

word.entryDescription: past participle of 'fly (to control or travel in an aircraft)
word.entryExample: Have you ever flown in a plane?

word.entryDescription: frequent changes in the amount, value or level of something
word.entryExample: Most weight fluctuations are normal and there's no need to worry about your health.

word.entryDescription: to control or travel in an aircraft; or to move through the air like a bird, insect or an aircraft
word.entryExample: Birds fly in the sky.

word.entryDescription: travelling in a plane
word.entryExample: Tom is scared of flying.

word.entryDescription: the central point of attention or interest
word.entryExample: There was too much focus on southern France and not enough on the rest of the country.

word.entryDescription: to concentrate
word.entryExample: You have to focus on three things.

word.entryDescription: to concentrate on something
word.entryExample: I have been following your advice and practising writing short messages which focus on the main points.

word.entryDescription: an enemy
word.entryExample: 'Friend or foe?' 'Let me in. It's me, Marie.'

word.entryDescription: damp cloudy weather near the land or sea, making it difficult to see far
word.entryExample: There is so much fog in London!

word.entryDescription: having fog
word.entryExample: London used to be very foggy.

word.entryDescription: modern music and songs written in a style resembling traditional music
word.entryExample: Emma's dad wants to see a folk singer perform tonight.

word.entryDescription: the things you eat
word.entryExample: The food in our school cafeteria is really great.

word.entryDescription: (plural 'feet') the part of your body that joins onto the end of your leg and you use for walking
word.entryExample: Kick the ball with your foot.

word.entryDescription: a wheel that moves when you press a pedal linked to the wheel with your foot
word.entryExample: He makes the pot on the turntable driven by a foot wheel.

word.entryDescription: a large ball you use to play the game of football
word.entryExample: I love playing football.

word.entryDescription: a large structure consisting of a central area for playing football surrounded by rows of seats for spectators
word.entryExample: Does your country have important spaces for sports, like football stadiums or motor racing circuits?

word.entryDescription: somebody who plays football
word.entryExample: Mary is a footballer.

word.entryDescription: a mark left by a foot or shoe
word.entryExample: The evidence a forensic team collects at a crime scene can include samples of different substances as well as copies or photographs of fingerprints, footprints or tyre tracks and even handwriting.

word.entryDescription: used to show how long something continues
word.entryExample: We have used the same recipe for over 20 years.

word.entryDescription: without payment
word.entryExample: If you buy one, you will get another one for free.

word.entryDescription: for example
word.entryExample: For instance, some are migrating further up mountains and away from the Equator.

word.entryDescription: because of this
word.entryExample: For this reason, I strongly recommend that we hold a similar event.

word.entryDescription: the main part of a picture at the front
word.entryExample: There are quite a lot of people in the foreground, and city buildings in the background.

word.entryDescription: the scientific methods, tests and techniques used by experts to investigate a crime
word.entryExample: What do you think forensics experts do?

word.entryDescription: a large area of trees
word.entryExample: Bears live in the forest.

word.entryDescription: the richly organic layer of soil and decomposed leaves, branches, bark, etc.
word.entryExample: In the spring, the forest floor is covered with beautiful, small flowers.

word.entryDescription: for all time; for a very long time
word.entryExample: I hope we'll be friends forever!

word.entryDescription: not worth remembering, likely to be forgotten
word.entryExample: The whole evening was quite forgettable. I can't even remember what I ate.

word.entryDescription: to stop feeling anger towards someone for what they did
word.entryExample: I still can't forgive the burglar for stealing my Xbox.

word.entryDescription: a small tool with a handle and points which you use for eating
word.entryExample: I've got a fork, but I haven't got a knife.

word.entryDescription: a document with spaces in which you write required information
word.entryExample: I put my application form in an envelope and sent it off.

word.entryDescription: official; not casual
word.entryExample: Have you ever volunteered in a formal or informal way?

word.entryDescription: items of clothing that are considered official, not casual
word.entryExample: Do you like wearing formal clothes?

word.entryDescription: of the past but not anymore
word.entryExample: He is a former professional and champion skateboarder.

word.entryDescription: used to show that something happens due to good luck
word.entryExample: Fortunately, no one was hurt in the accident.

word.entryDescription: a very large amount of money
word.entryExample: Oh dear! My trousers! They're torn! They cost me a fortune!

word.entryDescription: a fuel that is formed in the earth from dead plants and animals
word.entryExample: Fossil fuels include natural gas, oil and coal.

word.entryDescription: past tense of 'find' – to discover; to see something after searching for it
word.entryExample: The prince found Cinderella.

word.entryDescription: a stream of water usually forced upwards; used for decoration
word.entryExample: There's a beautiful fountain in the middle of the square.

word.entryDescription: the number 4
word.entryExample: Tables usually have four legs.

word.entryDescription: the number 14
word.entryExample: Two weeks is fourteen days.

word.entryDescription: in the position of number four when we count
word.entryExample: Why is the fourth of July special in the US?

word.entryDescription: a wild animal like a small dog with a pointed face and a bushy tail
word.entryExample: Foxes are associated with being cunning.

word.entryDescription: (of a bone or other hard structure) to break or crack
word.entryExample: I fractured my nose.

word.entryDescription: the crime of deceiving people in order to get money or goods
word.entryExample: Forensic science techniques are also adopted to investigate and solve crimes such as burglary, robbery, fraud and even road accidents.

word.entryDescription: somebody who commits fraud
word.entryExample: Never put your address on your social media profile, it's just an invitation for fraudsters.

word.entryDescription: the state of being able to say or do what you want without restriction or control
word.entryExample: Travelling by car gives us lots of freedom to bring lots of luggage.

word.entryDescription: (of computer) to become blocked and stop working
word.entryExample: What should you do if your computer freezes?
